thread.title: Big 3: the biggest entertainment events Saturday and Sunday
thread.title_full: Big 3: the biggest entertainment events Saturday and Sunday

author: detroitnews.com
title: Big 3: the biggest entertainment events Saturday and Sunday
text:
Singer Stephanie Mills (Photo: Stephanie Mills) 

1. Dine Drink Detroit 
More than two dozen participating restaurants will offer a special fixed price featuring at least one item of food and one drink for $15. Some of the participating spots are Chartreuse Kitchen & Cocktails, Jolly Pumpkin, Bobcat Bonnie’s, Antietam and Batch Brewing Company. The promotion runs through Oct. 10. dinedrinkdetroit.com
2. ‘Evil Dead: the Musical’ at City Theatre 
It’s the opening weekend of this annual favorite, a stage version of Sam Raimi’s 1980s cult classic. Hear the local cast perform songs like “All the Men in My Life Keep Getting Killed by Candarian Demons” and “Do the Necronomicon.” 8 p.m. Sat. (runs through Oct. 31). $30. 2301 Woodward, Detroit. (313) 471-3465.
3. Stephanie Mills at Andiamo Celebrity Showroom 
The R&B, soul and gospel singer started her career playing Dorothy in the original Broadway production of “The Wiz.” Her career is coming full circle, as she’s slated to play Aunt Em in the live special of the production to air this holiday season on NBC. 8 p.m. Sun. $25-$75. 7096 E. 14 Mile, Warren. (586) 268-3200.
Melody Baetens
